timestamp: Welcome to Tampa, Florida, a city where
you can ride a roller coaster, eat a
Cuban sandwich, and spot a wild chicken
in the streets, all before lunch. This
is where I live. And in this video, I'm
going to show you around just a little
bit, and break down everything you need
to know to plan the perfect Tampa trip,
including how to get here, how to get
around, where to stay, what to eat, and
of course, some of the best things to do
in and around the city. Let's go.

text: Tampa Airport
If you're flying in, well, you're in
luck because Tampa International Airport
is consistently ranked as one of the
best airports in the country. Yeah, the
whole country. And I really strongly
agree. This is a great airport and it's
kind of a big point of local pride
around here. We love this airport around
here. It's just about 15 to 20 minutes
or so, give or take, depending on
traffic from downtown. And it's
shockingly efficient. like you're off
the plane, you've grabbed your luggage,
and you're in your Uber in under 20
minutes, efficient. And if you think I'm
exaggerating, I'm really not. This is
easily one of the best designed airports
in the world. And it's really, really
easy to navigate quickly and find your
way around. And if you're here, don't
forget to say hi to Phoebe the Flamingo
while you're here. This incredible
sculpture right here in the main
concourse has quickly become a local
icon, and it's great for your Instagram,
too.
Once here, your main options from the
airport are going to be renting a car,
probably the best way to explore the
area. This isn't really a great city for
public transport, if I'm being honest, a
ride share or taxi, or a hotel shuttle
if you're staying nearby. And if you're
heading into town for a cruise, Port
Tampa Bay is right next to downtown. So,
you're just steps away from all the
action with lots of places to stay and

timestamp: Now, Tampa is unfortunately not one of
those cities that's really easy to get
around if you don't have a car. Some

is pretty lacking when it comes to

So, that's pretty cool. And if you're

reasonable. Compared to other big

to park around here. So, I honestly
can't complain too much about what
